title: Freeway & Expressway Driving
objectives: Enter, merge, and exit freeways safely using proper scanning and signaling.
Manage speed and space at high speeds, including safe following distances and lane discipline.
Perform lane changes with mirror, signal, head-checks; choose lanes based on traffic flow and destination.
Handle breakdowns, debris, and emergencies; apply California Move Over law.
Navigate carpool/HOV and express/toll lanes, and respond to ramp meters.

lessons.title: Ramp Types, Acceleration Lanes & Ramp Meters
content: Freeway ramps include loop, directional, and cloverleaf designs. Use the acceleration lane to reach a speed that matches freeway traffic.
Ramp meters (red/green lights) release vehicles in short intervals to reduce merging conflicts. Obey posted signals and signs.

lessons.title: Merging Etiquette & Lane Selection
content: Merge into the first safe gap without forcing others to brake hard. Maintain steady acceleration and avoid stopping on the ramp unless signed.

lessons.title: Speed Management & Flow
content: Obey posted maximums and drive a speed that is reasonable for conditions. Flow speed can inform—but never justify—unsafe speeds.

lessons.title: Following Distance & Space Cushions
content: Use at least a 3–4 second following distance in ideal conditions; add time for rain, darkness, heavy loads, or when following large trucks.

lessons.title: Safe Lane Changes & Blind Spots
content: Follow the mirror–signal–head check routine. Avoid lingering next to other vehicles and never cut off a vehicle in the fast lane.

lessons.title: Exit Strategies & Missed Exits
content: Signal and move to the exit lane early. Reduce speed only after entering the deceleration lane; never brake abruptly in a travel lane.

lessons.title: Breakdowns & Roadside Safety
content: If your vehicle fails, signal right, exit if possible, or steer fully onto the shoulder. Use hazard lights and stay behind a barrier if available.

lessons.title: HOV/Carpool & Express/Toll Lanes
content: Carpool lanes have occupancy or vehicle-type rules; express lanes may require transponders or tolls. Enter/exit only where permitted.
